prism-agent-selection.description: Decision procedure for selecting model tier (Opus/Sonnet/Haiku) and specific agent based on task complexity, cost, and capability requirements
triggers: Is this an Opus or Sonnet task?
Which model should I use for this?

prism-anti-regression-checklists.name: prism-anti-regression-checklists
prism-anti-regression-checklists.description: Domain-specific regression checklists for documents, databases, code modules, and skills — what to inventory and compare per file type
triggers: What specifically should I check for regression in this [document/database/code/skill]?

prism-anti-regression-process.name: prism-anti-regression-process
prism-anti-regression-process.description: 4-phase protocol for replacing any file without losing content — Inventory, Create, Compare, Verdict
triggers: I need to rewrite this file
replace this with a new version

prism-anti-regression-size-analysis.name: prism-anti-regression-size-analysis
prism-anti-regression-size-analysis.description: Size heuristics and delta decision tree for detecting regressions — expected sizes by operation type and interpretation of size changes
triggers: My replacement is smaller/larger — is that a regression?
What size should I expect for a [rewrite/consolidation/bug fix]?

prism-async-patterns.name: prism-async-patterns
prism-async-patterns.description: Three async execution patterns for PRISM engines — parallel with Promise.all, controlled concurrency limiter, and debounce/throttle for rate-sensitive operations

prism-batch-efficiency.name: prism-batch-efficiency
prism-batch-efficiency.description: Token budget allocation, operation batching rules, and caching patterns — reduce tool call round trips by 3-5x through parallel batch execution
triggers: How should I allocate my context budget?

prism-caching-patterns.name: prism-caching-patterns
prism-caching-patterns.description: Three caching strategies for PRISM engines — memoization for pure functions, LRU for repeated lookups, TTL for time-sensitive data — with decision tree for which to use
triggers: Machine capabilities change but we cache them
Material lookups are slow and we keep requesting the same ones
This calculation is called 50 times with the same inputs

prism-codebase-packaging.name: prism-codebase-packaging
prism-codebase-packaging.description: Pack entire codebases into AI-friendly single files for analysis using Repomix. Use when analyzing legacy code, planning extraction, performing code review, generating documentation, or preparing context for Claude sessions. Essential for PRISM monolith navigation.

prism-context-pressure.name: prism-context-pressure
prism-context-pressure.description: Context pressure zones with response caps — 4 zones (green/yellow/orange/red), 3 metrics (tool calls, exchange depth, response length), and mandatory zone actions
triggers: Am I running out of context?

prism-error-recovery-strategies.name: prism-error-recovery-strategies
prism-error-recovery-strategies.description: Three recovery patterns for PRISM failures — retry with exponential backoff for transient errors, circuit breaker for cascading failures, fallback values for non-critical defaults

prism-error-taxonomy.name: prism-error-taxonomy
prism-error-taxonomy.description: PrismError class hierarchy with 6 error categories and their mandatory treatment — safety blocks execution, network retries, data logs and continues
triggers: How should this failure be handled?
What error type should I throw here?

prism-formula-calibration.name: prism-formula-calibration
prism-formula-calibration.description: When and how to recalibrate PRISM formulas — 5 trigger conditions, the calibration procedure, performance metrics computation, and A/B version comparison

prism-formula-lifecycle.name: prism-formula-lifecycle
prism-formula-lifecycle.description: 7-stage procedure for formula management — INVENT through DEPRECATE with required actions, validation gates, and registry operations at each stage
triggers: How do I register a new formula?
What stage is this formula at?

prism-gcode-coordinate-systems.name: prism-gcode-coordinate-systems
prism-gcode-coordinate-systems.description: Cross-controller coordinate system G-codes — work offsets (G54-G59), extended WCS, absolute/incremental, local/machine coordinates, plane selection across 7 controller families
triggers: How do I set work offset on Siemens?
Switch between absolute and incremental mid-program
What plane codes does Heidenhain use?

prism-gcode-motion-codes.name: prism-gcode-motion-codes
prism-gcode-motion-codes.description: Cross-controller motion G-code syntax for rapid, linear, arc, helix, and spline moves across Fanuc, Siemens, Haas, Mazak, Heidenhain, Mitsubishi, and Okuma
triggers: How do I program a helix on Fanuc vs Haas?
What's the G-code for circular interpolation on Siemens?

prism-gcode-tool-compensation.name: prism-gcode-tool-compensation
prism-gcode-tool-compensation.description: Cross-controller tool compensation G-codes — cutter radius comp (G40-G42), tool length offset (G43/G44/G49), 3D and dynamic compensation (G43.4/TCPM/TRAORI) across 7 controller families
triggers: G43.4 dynamic compensation — which controllers support it?
Tool length offset differences between controllers

prism-hook-architecture.description: Hook system mechanics — 25 categories, priority levels 0-999, registration API, execution model, blocking vs warning patterns, and error handling
triggers: How do I register a hook?
What priority should my hook use?

prism-hook-authoring.description: How to register, execute, and chain PRISM hooks — priority levels, blocking vs warning patterns, error handling, and the 25 hook categories
triggers: How do I register a custom hook?
What priority should my hook use?

prism-hook-enforcement.name: prism-hook-enforcement

triggers: How do I scope this work?

prism-pattern-selection.description: Design pattern decision tree for PRISM development — which GoF pattern solves which problem, with manufacturing-specific use cases and anti-pattern warnings
triggers: Should I use Factory or Builder here?

What do I do when I'm done?

prism-session-recovery.description: Recovery protocols for 4 scenarios — normal resume, post-compaction, cross-device, and emergency — with priority reading order and handoff format
triggers: Continue from where we left off

prism-wiring-procedure.description: Step-by-step procedure for wiring databases to consumers via gateway — register database, register consumers, add routes, verify utilization

prism-wiring-validation.description: Pre-migration and consumer registration checklists — 7-phase database validation, 6-phase consumer validation, and troubleshooting for common wiring failures

prism-coverage-metrics.description: Three formulas to measure completeness and utilization — MCI for material parameter coverage, DUF for database consumer utilization, TCC for task completion confidence

Is this material complete enough for production?

prism-effort-estimation.description: Estimate tool calls and sessions needed for a task — base scope count, complexity multipliers, risk factor, producing an effort range with 95% confidence interval
triggers: How many tool calls will this take?

prism-process-quality-audit.name: prism-process-quality-audit

prism-resource-scoring.description: Parse task requirements and compute capability scores for skills/agents/modes — steps 1-3 of the combination engine producing a ranked resource list

prism-batch-execution.description: Decision procedure for batching and parallelizing PRISM operations — when to batch, how to structure parallel calls, expected speedup

prism-cache-selection.name: prism-cache-selection
prism-cache-selection.description: Decision procedure for choosing cache strategy — memoize for pure functions, LRU for hot data with size limits, TTL for time-sensitive data

prism-prompt-crafting.name: prism-prompt-crafting
prism-prompt-crafting.description: 7-step procedure for crafting PRISM prompts — analyze, select framework (Direct/CRAFT/RISEN/CoT), calibrate, contextualize, resolve ambiguity, format, document

prism-prompt-quality-scoring.description: Score a prompt using 6 gates (clarity, completeness, format, constraints, safety, context), compute PQS, and determine go/no-go threshold

prism-token-budget.description: Compute working token budget, allocate across 4 categories (task/skills/state/buffer), and execute threshold actions at each pressure level

prism-algorithm-decision-tree.description: 3-step routing procedure — identify problem category, apply constraints, select PRISM engine — with 6 problem type tables and constraint matching

prism-capability-scoring.name: prism-capability-scoring
prism-capability-scoring.description: F-RESOURCE-001 capability scoring formula — compute Cap(r,T) from domain match (Jaccard), operation coverage, and complexity alignment with uncertainty propagation

prism-context-loading.name: prism-context-loading
prism-context-loading.description: Step-by-step procedure for loading codebase into Claude's context — token counting, 4-step reduction pipeline, module splitting strategy, and session loading workflow

prism-repomix-patterns.name: prism-repomix-patterns
prism-repomix-patterns.description: Exact repomix commands for packing PRISM code for Claude analysis — 5 patterns for monolith analysis, module extraction, anti-regression comparison, token optimization, and remote repos

prism-psi-equation.description: F-PSI-001 master combination equation — the argmax optimization that selects optimal skill+agent+mode combinations for any task

prism-resource-combination.name: prism-resource-combination
prism-resource-combination.description: 8-step procedure for executing F-PSI-001 — from parsing task requirements through ILP solving to handoff

prism-process-quality-score.name: prism-process-quality-score
prism-process-quality-score.description: P(x) process quality formula — geometric mean of 11 session metrics with quality gates and improvement targeting

prism-skill-activation.name: prism-skill-activation
prism-skill-activation.description: ACTIVATION_SCORE formula for deciding which skills to load — keyword matching, task fit, dependency readiness, and threshold-based activation

prism-optimality-certificate.name: prism-optimality-certificate
prism-optimality-certificate.description: F-PROOF-001 executable procedure — calculates optimality gap from ILP solver output, assigns certificate level, generates proof record with bounds and constraints

prism-wiring-verification.name: prism-wiring-verification
prism-wiring-verification.description: Build-time utilization verifier and validation checklists — run after wiring to confirm databases meet minimum consumer counts and all fields have documented consumers

prism-python-state-scripts.description: Python session/state/checkpoint scripts — start sessions, update state, generate context, and manage checkpoints from the command line

prism-python-validation-scripts.description: Python material/physics validation and audit scripts — validate material databases against 127-parameter schema, check physics consistency, find extraction gaps

prism-skill-loading-procedure.description: How to decide which skills to load at session boot and during execution — 5 loading levels, trigger pattern matching, and the priority cascade

prism-cadence-tuning.name: prism-cadence-tuning
prism-cadence-tuning.description: Tune auto-fire cadence intervals, add/remove cadence functions, adjust thresholds — the operational playbook for the autoHookWrapper timing system

prism-hook-activation-audit.name: prism-hook-activation-audit
prism-hook-activation-audit.description: Run hook activation coverage audits for any phase — identify missing hooks, diagnose wiring gaps, fix coverage issues using the HOOK_ACTIVATION_MATRIX

prism-session-script-runner.name: prism-session-script-runner
prism-session-script-runner.description: Execute enhanced startup/shutdown scripts, interpret their results, and take corrective action — the operational guide for DA-MS11 session lifecycle

prism-nl-hook-lifecycle.name: prism-nl-hook-lifecycle
prism-nl-hook-lifecycle.description: Full NL hook lifecycle — create from natural language, evaluate effectiveness, promote/retire, integrate with cadence auto-fire system

prism-agent-selector.name: prism-agent-selector
prism-agent-selector.description: Selects the optimal subset of agents for a task using Integer Linear Programming. Minimizes cost while ensuring full task coverage and tier balance.

prism-campaign-engine.name: prism-campaign-engine
prism-campaign-engine.description: Manages multi-operation machining campaigns with cumulative safety tracking, batch optimization, and cycle time estimation.

prism-decision-tree-engine.name: prism-decision-tree-engine
prism-decision-tree-engine.description: Rule-based selection trees for tooling, insert grades, coolant strategies, workholding, and machining approaches. Returns scored recommendations with reasoning chains.

prism-dev-state-scripts.name: prism-dev-state-scripts
prism-dev-state-scripts.description: Scripts for managing PRISM development state — checkpoints, snapshots, and state file management.

prism-event-bus-engine.name: prism-event-bus-engine
prism-event-bus-engine.description: Publish-subscribe event system for cross-engine communication. Enables reactive workflows where one engine's output triggers another engine's action.

prism-formula-performance-metrics.name: prism-formula-performance-metrics
prism-formula-performance-metrics.description: Compute and interpret 4 formula health metrics — MAE, MAPE, R-squared, Bias — with alert thresholds and corrective action triggers

prism-gcode-m-codes.name: prism-gcode-m-codes
prism-gcode-m-codes.description: Reference for G-code M-codes (machine auxiliary functions) across CNC controller families.

prism-gcode-template-engine.name: prism-gcode-template-engine
prism-gcode-template-engine.description: Generates controller-specific G-code for 6 CNC controller families across 13 operation types. Handles dialect differences (Fanuc G43 vs Siemens CYCLE800) automatically.

prism-inference-chain-engine.name: prism-inference-chain-engine
prism-inference-chain-engine.description: Multi-step physics reasoning chains that compose Kienzle, Taylor, and power calculations into complete machining parameter sets. Propagates uncertainty through each calculation step.

prism-report-renderer.name: prism-report-renderer
prism-report-renderer.description: Generates professional manufacturing documents from calculated data. Outputs formatted setup sheets, process plans, cost estimates, tool lists, inspection plans, alarm reports, and speed/feed cards.

prism-swarm-coordinator.name: prism-swarm-coordinator
prism-swarm-coordinator.description: Coordinates multi-agent swarm execution for optimal parallel task completion. Selects appropriate swarm patterns, distributes workload, and aggregates results while minimizing coordination overhead.

prism-tolerance-engine.name: prism-tolerance-engine
prism-tolerance-engine.description: ISO 286 tolerance analysis and shaft/hole fit calculations. Validates dimensional tolerances, calculates interference/clearance fits, and predicts assembly outcomes.

prism-validator.name: prism-validator
prism-validator.description: **Catch errors before they propagate.** Validates syntax, parameter ranges, cross-references, and physical consistency for materials and extracted modules.
